result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen B. Halverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 113 Brady St, Portage marked   "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."
Sentencing Hearing on 11-16-15 Br. 2.  Filed by Court reporter Dorothy A. Campbell.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called at 11:12 a.m.: 14CF310  & 14CF422, Defendant Owen B. Halverson in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing statements heard.  In both cases, Court sentenced defendant to 3 years probation in both cases. Conditions on each count: 1 year jail, concurrent with each other, starting  November 23, 2015 at 7 p.m.  Huber granted under jail rules. $518 costs on each, Submit DNA sample. Continue with AODA, continue with treatment recommended. Maintain absolute sobriety at all times. Not go upon businesses where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption. Jail credit to be determined. Court adjourned at 12:25 p.m.
Sentencing hearing at 11-16-2015 11:00 am

Judge Voigt extended to 7-20-15 - called PAP 7-6-15 - man
filed by Atty Riek and defendant.

Defendant Owen B. Halverson in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF310 & 14CF422.  Argument by Atty Riek as to why cases should be heard today.  State had no response.  Defendant is ready to plea on cases and have court order a PSI.  Court will proceed today with the pleas on both cases, and order a PSI.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CF310 defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  In 14CF422 defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1 with Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court ordered PSI for both cases.

Defendant Owen B. Halverson in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF310 & 14CF422.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.    Information filed, reading waived.  New return date requested by Atty Riek, a few months out so defendant can be eligible for agreement of treatment program and has time to complete it.  State has no objection.  Defendant is currently at Columbia County Jail.  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
